TITLE: War in Gaza likely to go on for 'many more months,' Netanyahu warns
SUMMARY: Danish shipping giant Maersk announced a 48-hour pause on all transits through the Bab-el-Mandeb strait, which connects the Red Sea to the Gulf of Aden and the Indian Ocean

TITLE: North Korea’s Kim vows to launch 3 more spy satellites and produce more nuclear materials in 2024
SUMMARY: Kim has been focusing on modernizing his nuclear arsenal since his diplomacy with Trump broke down in 2019

TITLE: New Year's Eve: Countries around the world ring in 2024
SUMMARY: From Australia to America, people around the globe gather to celebrate the start of another year

TITLE: North Korea's Kim Jong Un says military should 'annihilate' U.S. and South Korea if provoked
SUMMARY: North Korea has increased its warlike rhetoric in recent months in response to an expansion of U.S.-South Korean military drills

TITLE: Queen of Denmark says she will abdicate the throne after 52 years
SUMMARY: The queen made her announcement in her annual New Year’s Eve address, paving the way for her son Crown Prince Frederik to reign

TITLE: Mexican actor Ana Ofelia Murguía, who voiced Mama Coco in 'Coco,' dies at 90
SUMMARY: “Coco,” which was released in 2017, brought Murguía to an international audience late in life

TITLE: Japan reports dozens of fatalities after series of strong earthquakes
SUMMARY: Thousands evacuated from Noto Peninsula and Prime Minister Fumio Kishida says he will personally lead national response to disaster

TITLE: South Korean opposition leader injured in knife attack
SUMMARY: Lee Jae-myung, chairman of South Korea's Democratic Party, was conscious but would undergo surgery, authorities said

TITLE: Israel high court strikes down key part of Netanyahu judicial overhaul
SUMMARY: The ruling comes as Israel's military is preparing for "prolonged fighting" this year, amid raised tensions in the region that include clashes between U.S. forces and Iran-backed Houthi rebels

TITLE: Hong Kong activist publisher Jimmy Lai pleads not guilty in landmark national security trial
SUMMARY: He faces possible life imprisonment if convicted under a sweeping national security law imposed by Beijing. The trial is expected to last about 80 days without a jury

TITLE: Who's 'Fito,' Ecuador's infamous gang leader missing from prison?
SUMMARY: The Los Choneros gang leader's disappearance Sunday led the government to declare a state of emergency and send the military into prisons, sparking a wave of at least 30 attacks, including an assault at a television station in Guayaquil

TITLE: Argentina inflation surges past 200%, hitting highest level in decades
SUMMARY: President Javier Milei, who has been in office for just over a month, is looking to employ tough austerity measures to bring down inflation, reduce a deep fiscal deficit and rebuild government coffers

TITLE: Africa's Catholic hierarchy refuses same-sex blessings for being 'contrary to the will of God'
SUMMARY: The controversy has deepened a growing chasm between Pope Francis’ progressive, reform-minded papacy and the conservative church in much of the world

TITLE: U.S., British strikes on Houthis come after rebel's 27th attack on shipping
SUMMARY: The U.N.'s top court heard South Africa’s case that Israel’s military assault in the Gaza Strip amounts to genocide against Palestinians, an accusation Israel has denied

TITLE: Russian election candidate calls Ukraine war a 'big mistake' by Putin
SUMMARY: Boris Nadezhdin told the wives of Russia's mobilized soldiers the war was “a big mistake by Putin, of course, and the consequences will be very grave

TITLE: North Korea poised to admit first known tourists since 2020
SUMMARY: The four-day Russian tour will include stops in Pyongyang and a ski resort, according to an online itinerary

TITLE: Bong Joon-ho calls for investigation of police and media after death of 'Parasite' star Lee Sun-kyun
SUMMARY: Lee was found dead in his car on Dec. 27 in what is widely seen as a suicide following an intense weekslong police investigation into his alleged drug use

TITLE: Israel-Hamas war live updates: U.S. conducts another strike against Houthi rebels in Yemen
SUMMARY: The Houthis, who control much of Yemen, vowed retaliation after last night's strikes — raising the risk of broader regional conflict with Iran-backed groups

TITLE: Netflix removes Indian film with meat-eating scene after Hindu backlash
SUMMARY: “Annapoorani — The Goddess of Food,” a Tamil-language film, was no longer available on the international streaming platform as of Thursday
